pullrequest.title: Fix for gripper tag work as grasp hack

content.raw:
I'm afraid that several of the changes will break the ABI compatibility, so it is not possible to release this in the 1.9  branch. Documentation about [what can break the ABI](http://techbase.kde.org/Policies/Binary_Compatibility_Issues_With_C++#The_Do.27s_and_Don.27ts) can help to understand the situation.

Things in this PR that will break the ABI:

 * Change parameters of an existing method (in any way)
 * Add new non static member of a class.
 * Remove existing non static data members.
content.html:
I'm afraid that several of the changes will break the ABI compatibility, so it is not possible to release this in the 1.9 branch. Documentation about what can break the ABI can help to understand the situation.

Things in this PR that will break the ABI:

  • Change parameters of an existing method (in any way)
  • Add new non static member of a class.
  • Remove existing non static data members.
